title: Opinion on new 2024 rules for flanking

posts.author: ClericofChaos
posts.content:
I've been thinking about rules lately and wanted to get everyone's opinions.

Quick question about rules that came up in our game last night.

The rules for rules seem a bit ambiguous to me. On page 123 it states one thing, but then on page 145 it seems to contradict that. How do you interpret this?

What do you all think? Has anyone else had similar questions about rules?
posts.thread_title: Opinion on new 2024 rules for flanking

posts.author: CriticalMiss
posts.content:
Looking at page 127 of the Player's Handbook, it states that flanking functions based on your proficiency bonus and ability modifiers.

We had a hilarious situation where our Bard tried to use flanking to negotiate with a dragon. It went exactly as you'd expect!

Has anyone tried optimizing a build around flanking? I'm curious about the best way to leverage this for my character.

I actually disagree with some of the previous comments about flanking. Based on my experience, it works differently.

In my campaign, we had a situation with flanking that played out really well. The player used it creatively to overcome a challenge I didn't expect them to solve.
